multiple.question:
Which number should be the coefficient in front of CO2 so that the carbon atoms in the reactants are the same as in the products?

CO2 + H2O → C6H12O6 + O2

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

multiple.question:
Which number should be the coefficient in front of H2O so that the hydrogen atoms in the reactants are the same as in the products?

6CO2 + H2O → C6H12O6 + O2

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.
(bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images, (others)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.
(bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images, (others)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.

multiple.question:
How can you balance the number of oxygen atoms in this equation?

6CO2 + 6H2O → C6H12O6 + O2

answers.answer: Add a 12 before the O2 in the products.
Add a 6 before the O2 in the products.
Add a 2 before the C6H12O6 in the products.
Add a 2 before the O6 in C6H12O6 of the products.

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.
(bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images, (others)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images.

multiple.question: Every chemical equation must be balanced so that it obeys the law of conservation of mass.

What are the products in this equation?

CH4 + O2 → CO2 + H2

Which of the following is NOT true of this sign?

→

answers.answer: It is called the yield sign.
It separates the reactants from the products.
The reactants are to the left of the sign.
The products are to the right of the sign.
The sign tells that the equation is balanced.

multiple.question:
How many oxygen atoms are present on each side of this balanced equation?

C + O2 → CO2

How many oxygen atoms are present on each side of this balanced equation?

3CuSO4 + 2Al → 3Cu + Al2(SO4)3

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.
